com.novartis.opensource.yada

Class Finder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.Finder

  • public class Finder
extends Object
    Provides for retrieval YADA query code and metadata from the YADA Index as encapsulated YADAQuery objects.
    Since:
    0.4.0.0
    Author:
    David Varon

      • JNDI_PREFIX

        public static final String JNDI_PREFIX
        Hardcoded to the stardard value: "java:comp/env". Used to identify mapped sources in the YADA Index.

      • YADA_INDEX

        public static final String YADA_INDEX
        Currently hardcoded to "/jdbc/yada", this may be configurable in a future version. Used to access the YADA Index.

        private static final String YADA_PKG_SQL
        Constant equal to: select a.sql "+YADA_QUERY+", b.source "+YADA_SOURCE+", nvl(b.version,'na') "+YADA_VERSION+", nvl(c.target,'na') "+YADA_PARAMTARGET+", nvl(c.name,'na') "+YADA_PARAMNAME+", nvl(c.value,'na') "+YADA_PARAMVAL+", c.rule "+YADA_PARAMRULE+" from yada_query a join yada_query_conf b on a.app = b.app left join yada_params c on (a.app = c.target or a.name = c.target) where a.name = ? order by c.target

    • Method Detail

      • getEnv

        public static String getEnv(String jndiPath)
                     throws YADAResourceException
        Retreives the environment variables mapped to the application context using JNDI, for example, "io/in", or "yada_bin". If jndiPath is not found in the application context, an ottempt is made to find a system property with the same name.
        Parameters:
        jndiPath - a string registered in the application context, or system property
        Returns:
        String value of variable mapped to JNDI parameter string
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when the JNDI string is not found in the application context or system properties

      • getYADAJndi

        public static String getYADAJndi()
        Convenient wrapper to return a String equal to JNDI_PREFIX + YADA_INDEX
        Returns:
        String equal to JNDI_PREFIX + YADA_INDEX

      • getQueryFromIndex

        public YADAQuery getQueryFromIndex(String q)
                            throws YADAConnectionException,
                                   YADAFinderException
        Retrieves the query q from the distributed index (i.e., database). Typically the query is then added to the in-memory cache.
        Parameters:
        q - the query name to retrieve
        Returns:
        the YADAQuery retrieved from the distributed index
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - if the query q can't be found in the YADA index. Check your spelling and case.
        YADAConnectionException - if an error occurs when attempting to query the YADA Index. This could be the result of a configuration issue.
        See Also:
        getQuery(String)

      • getQuery

        public YADAQuery getQuery(String q)
                   throws YADAConnectionException,
                          YADAFinderException
        Overloaded version of getQuery(String, boolean) always passing true in the second updateStats arg.
        Parameters:
        q - the stored canonical name of the desired YADAQuery
        Returns:
        YADAQuery object encapsulating the query code and parameters
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - if the query q can't be found in the YADA index. Check your spelling and case.
        YADAConnectionException - if an error occurs when attempting to query the YADA Index. This could be the result of a configuration issue.
        Since:
        0.5.0.0

      • getQuery

        public YADAQuery getQuery(String q,
                 boolean updateStats)
                   throws YADAConnectionException,
                          YADAFinderException
        A cornerstone to the entire YADA framework, this method takes the name of a stored query as an argument and returns a YADAQuery object containing the query code and default parameters, as well as data structures and methods to facilitate it's execution.

        There is now an EhCache implementation in which all queries are stored upon retrieval. When a query is subsequently requested, it is found in the cache, cloned, and the clone put to use.

        Parameters:
        q - the stored canonical name of the desired YADAQuery
        updateStats - set to true to execute parallel operation to query update access count and date, false to suppress the operation
        Returns:
        YADAQuery object encapsulating the query code and parameters
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - if the query q can't be found in the YADA index. Check your spelling and case.
        YADAConnectionException - if an error occurs when attempting to query the YADA Index. This could be the result of a configuration issue.
        Since:
        0.4.0.0
        See Also:
        YADAQuery

      • setDefaultParam

        private void setDefaultParam(YADAQuery yq,
                   ResultSet rs)
                      throws YADAFinderException
        Wraps default parameter data stored in the YADAIndex into a YADAParam object and adds it to yq.
        Parameters:
        yq - the YADAQuery to which to add the parameter defined in rs
        rs - the data containing the parameter, as retrieved from the YADA Index
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - when rs can't be processed

      • updateQueryStatistics

        void updateQueryStatistics(String qname)
                     throws YADAConnectionException,
                            YADAFinderException
        A utility method called in a separate thread by getQuery(String) to increment a query-access counter in the YADA Index.
        Parameters:
        qname - the name of the query just requested
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the YADA Index can't be accessed
        YADAFinderException - when qname can't be found in the YADA Index.
        See Also:
        getQuery(String)
